strings: <Cap><leader> discovers a new recipe for the alchemy pot!
<Cap><string_1> <equal> <Cap><string_2> + <Cap><string_3>
<Cap><string_1> <equal> <Cap><string_2> + <Cap><string_3> + <Cap><string_4>
<se_high>*: (Slurp) People say I'm the most contrary slime around these parts!
<se_high>*: Did you come to see the old man who lives here?
<se_high>*: Ha hah! Well, he's not here! And I'm not telling you where he is either!
<se_high>*: See! Pretty contrary, wouldn't you say!?
<se_high>*: Huh! That's no fun! Everyone that comes here is here to see him!
<se_high>*: Do you really, really want to know where he is? I bet you do! I bet you're dying to know!
<se_high>*: Well, I'm not going to tell you! I'm contrary, see!
<se_high>*: Huh! Well, I'm going to tell you whether you like it or not! I'm contrary, see!
<se_high>*: He's gone to the mystical spring to the west of here. (Slurp)
<se_def>*: Me stupid, so I no know what you say...
<se_high>*: I wouldn't bother talking to him if I were you. He can't speak human, so he always says the same thing.
<se_high>*: Ky-ky-ky! The old man used to work at the castle-ky!
<se_high>*: He was really, really important-ky!
<se_high>*: (Slurp) People say I'm the most contrary slime around these parts!
<se_high>*: If you've come to see the old man who lives here, he's out!
<se_high>*: So there's no point looking for him in the room next door! That's what I'm telling you, and I'm contrary so it must be true!
<se_high>*: If you've come to see the old man who lives here, he's out!
<se_high>*: Huh!? You think I'm lying!? That's not a very nice thing to say!
<se_high>*: I'm not going to talk to you any more! Pah!
<se_high>*: Pah!
<se_def>*: TeN...
<se_def>*: niNe...
<se_def>*: EiGhT...
<se_def>*: Seven...
<se_def>*: SixEn...
<se_def>*: FIvE...
<se_def>*: fOuR...
<se_def>*: THrEe...
<se_def>*: TwEe...
<se_def>*: OnE...
<se_def>*: Sorry. I do bad smell...
<se_def>*: Me stupid, so I no know what you say...
<se_high>*: Ky-ky-ky! We were all kept in cages on display back when the old man used to work at the castle-ky!
<se_high>*: He felt sorry for us and bought us from our old owner-ky! He's our saviour-ky!
<se_low>The Seer: Oh... Didn't we meet before? Yes, at the mystical spring. How nice of you to come and visit me again.
<se_low>The Seer: I've been trying to think of a way to rid Princess Medea of her curse.<page>The Seer: But no matter how much I ponder over it, I'm afraid I always come to the same conclusion.
<se_low>The Seer: The only thing you can do is find the person that cursed her in the first place.
<se_low>The Seer: It's going to be a long and difficult journey for you. You should make sure you have a rest from time to time.

<se_low>The Seer: If you go northwest out of the forest, you'll come to a town called Baccarat.<page>The Seer: They have a casino there and a quite enchanting stage show. You should go and unwind when you have the chance.
<se_low>The Seer: I know you're in the middle of a long and difficult journey, but you should make sure you have a rest from time to time.

<se_low>The Seer: If you go northwest out of the forest, you'll come to a town called Baccarat.<page>The Seer: They have a casino there and a quite enchanting stage show. You should go and unwind when you have the chance.
<se_low>The Seer: ...No! I don't believe it! The owner has been murdered and the casino's been shut down!?
<se_low>The Seer: And the culprit is the very same Dhoulmagus that you're chasing after!? How uncanny!
<se_low>The Seer: Mr. Golding murdered and his casino shut down... What will become of Baccarat? ...I just can't believe it!
<se_low>The Seer: And the culprit is the very same Dhoulmagus that you're chasing after! How uncanny!
<se_low>The Seer: Just north of this land you will find a stone arch bridging the straits. A sailor once told me of a giant sea dragon in the waters there.
<se_low>The Seer: He said it cast a spell on him that left him blinded for a few moments.
<se_low>The Seer: I suppose it's possible a bright light such as that could return the magic to the mirror.
<se_low>The Seer: You never know, it might just work. Try using the mirror to reflect the sea dragon spell!
<se_low>The Seer: Well, well! So you've succeeded in restoring magic to the sun mirror!
<se_low>The Seer: I feel the same magical power in it as when I touched it long ago back in Argonia. Well done!
<se_low>The Seer: Do you remember what we talked about the first time we met at the spring, <leader>?
<se_low>The Seer: I believe I told you that the only way to lift Princess Medea's curse was to defeat the person who placed it.
<se_low>The Seer: So now you're trying to find him and fight him.<page>The Seer: But a curse that strong could only be used by a truly great sorcerer. He will be a formidable adversary.
<se_low>The Seer: You must proceed in your quest with utmost caution.
<se_low>The Seer: I'm afraid the only way to lift Princess Medea's curse is to defeat the person who placed it.
<se_low>The Seer: And now you're trying to find him and fight him.<page>The Seer: But a curse that strong could only be used by a truly great sorcerer. He will be a formidable adversary.
<se_low>The Seer: You must proceed in your quest with utmost caution.
<se_low>The Seer: Good heavens! You've finally defeated Dhoulmagus!? So Princess Medea's curse has been lifted!?
<se_low>The Seer: She's still cursed!? But that can't be...<page>The Seer: I was convinced that she would be returned to normal the moment you defeated the one who cursed her!

<se_low>The Seer: I'm afraid I don't know what else to suggest...<page>The Seer: You should at least try to take her to the spring every now and then by way of comfort. Beyond that... Oh dear, oh dear...
<se_low>The Seer: I was convinced that the Princess would be returned to normal the moment you defeated the one who cursed her.<page>The Seer: I'm afraid I don't know what else to suggest...

<se_low>The Seer: You should take her back to the spring whenever you can so that she's able to return to her human form.<page>The Seer: Even though it's only temporary, I'm sure it will be of some comfort to her.
<se_def>*: Me stupid so forget how to strange dance.
<se_def>*: Even I get invite dance, me flower on wall. 110% sure.
<se_def>*: Me stupid, so I no know what you say...
<se_high>*: Ky-ky-ky! If I go outdoors, I get thirsty for human blood-ky!
<se_high>*: But I don't feel that way indoors, so don't panic-ky!
<se_low>The Seer: Hm? I know that voice. It's you, isn't it, <leader>? How nice of you to pay me a visit.
<se_low>The Seer: Now, whatever is going on in the world at the moment. Tell me all you know!
<se_low>The Seer: Oh dear... So the Lord of Darkness has placed the world on the brink of destruction.
<se_low>The Seer: Come to think of it, when I let my monsters out lately, they get frightened and make some beastly noises.<page>The Seer: No doubt that's because of Rhapthorne too.
<se_low>The Seer: And you're planning on confronting an all-powerful being like him, are you?

<se_low>The Seer: I won't try to stop you, but do try not to put <IF_SOLO>yourself<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>yourselves<ENDIF_SOLO> in too much danger.<page>The Seer: Your King would be terribly sad to lose you. And so would I.
<se_low>The Seer: You're planning on confronting an all-powerful being like the Lord of Darkness, are you?

<se_low>The Seer: I won't try to stop you, but do try not to put <IF_SOLO>yourself<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>yourselves<ENDIF_SOLO> in too much danger.<page>The Seer: Your King would be terribly sad to lose you. And so would I.
<se_low>The Seer: Hm? Who are...? Ah, one of <hero>'s friends, I see. Very good. I'm glad you've paid me a visit.
<se_high>*: (Slurp) I don't mind humans when I'm indoors.
<se_high>*: But when I'm outside, I can't help attacking them!
<se_high>*: So don't try talking to me outside unless you want to die!
<se_def>*: Sometimes hear voice in head.
<se_def>*: Monster all Dark World people. Serve Dark Lord. Make world dark...or something...
<se_def>*: Me stupid. No know word meaning.
<se_high>*: Ky-ky-ky! I used to like going out at night, but now I'm too scared-ky!
<se_high>*: I won't be doing that again-ky! I'm sure I'd never make it back, so no more nights out for me-ky!
<se_low>The Seer: Zzzz...zzzz...
